Title: ADNOC Drilling secures $733 million in offshore drilling contracts for massive Zakum oil field - WorldOil
Summary: ADNOC Drilling has been awarded $733 million in contracts for three island drilling rigs at the offshore Zakum oil field. These rigs will utilize advanced technology and AI to enhance performance and safety. Operations are expected to commence in 2026, with the rigs being capable of extended reach drilling and reducing costs and emissions. This development is part of ADNOC's strategy to meet growing energy demands and improve efficiency and safety.

Title: ExxonMobil lands promising pair of exploration blocks in North Africa - Upstream Online
Summary: ExxonMobil has secured two exploration blocks in shallow waters offshore Morocco. This acquisition is part of ExxonMobil's strategy to assess the oil and gas potential in North Africa, particularly in Morocco, where the company aims to leverage its expertise to explore hydrocarbon resources.

Title: Sitka Expands Exploration Program at its RC Gold Project in Yukon to Include Drilling and Surface Work on the Newly ... - StockTitan
Summary: Sitka Gold Corp. has expanded its 2024 exploration program at the RC Gold Project in Yukon to include diamond drilling and additional geochemical surveys on the newly acquired Clear Creek property. The program aims to extend findings from historical drilling, integrate extensive datasets, and accelerate new gold discoveries. Significant historical drilling results indicate high potential for gold targets, setting the stage for potentially substantial discoveries.

Title: Rig arrives in Canada ready to launch key exploration campaign - Upstream Online
Summary: The Hercules semisub rig has arrived in Bay Bulls, Newfoundland & Labrador, Canada, to commence a key exploration campaign for Equinor. The rig will drill two wells as part of this campaign, marking a significant step in Equinor's exploration activities in the region.
